data.title: 24 hr coffee shop
data.text: A great 24 coffee shop in a casino in the downtown of Reno almost under the sign, Day or nite a great place to eat fast at any hour.

data.title: Yummy Bakery
data.text: The bakery items were not only very pleasing to the eye but so tasty.  Open 24 hours. Breakfast was fast and lots of variety.

data.title: Great coffee shop!
data.text: love this coffee shop!  Open 24 hours, good food and service.  The pastries are amazing!  This is our go- to place for a quick meal!

data.title: Nice restaurant for a casual meal
data.text: Situated inside the El Dorado Casino, this restaurant is a nice place to have a casual meal.  The decor is pleasant, the menu is good, and the service was great.  I had a patty melt that was delicious...I also ordered onion rings were were merely fair.  The only complaint I had was that they played the background music too loud...it was a little difficult to have a conversation without raising one's voice.

data.title: Looks grand...
data.text: So by looks alone, the food was eye watering.  We only got coffee and really it was just ok.  I got a triple mocha and it tasted like a watered hot cocoa with no coffee.  I kick myself for not getting one of the cakes... I'll re-review if and when we go back to the El Dorado (not likely ever stating again tho) but that was another review...

data.title: better than a buffet.
data.text: dont you ever get tire at eating at buffets. this a family restaurant. the surroundings are like a garden setting. the food i order chicken pop pie was a big surprise. i meanBIG. that and coffee was enough to feed this starving visitor. in fact during my four day stay i ate at millies at least three times and came away a happy camper.

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text:
On a recent trip to Reno we visited this  restaurant for breakfast,  as it was convenient while staying at El Dorado. 
We were so delighted to find both the food and service were excellent. Would highly recommend this place for breakfast.

data.title: I did give it a second chance.....
data.text: We ate there for breakfast the first day we arrived. The food was plain bad as we could not identify the cheese product that felt like it was not enhancing the food but rather disintegrating on top of it!?  (We did have a good laugh though.) We gave them a second chance when ordering room service. The biscuits were soooooo hard that they were inedible.I simply can not recommend this place until they choose to serve real food.

owner_response.author: P_Campitelli, F & B Coordinator at Millies24, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave your comments in regards to your dining experience. We work hard to offer exceptional food as well as outstanding service and I want to apologize that your expectations were not met as those are not the expectations we set for ourselves. I will be sure to pass your feedback on to our entire team as we are constantly using this to improve our services for our guests, such as yourself. We hope that you will give us another chance in the future to host you to a true "five star' dining experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: After 6 years, no more
data.text:
My wife and I have gone here for gelato twice a week for 6 years.  Suddenly, this week the price went up by 50%!!!

How do you justify that?  You don't - so we're going someplace else.  You'd think they'd know - give 'em a reason to come in and they'll gamble here.

data.title: Great restaurant lots of food
data.text: We shared this restaurant with friends who had never been to the Eldorado.  We ate breakfast and lunch there.  They were surprised as to the amount of food on your plate.  Everything we had was very good and the enjoyed it very much.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Nice restaurant with attached bakery. Had breakfast of Huevos Rancheros. Very tasty. Service was very good and quick. Restaurant was a little dark but overall a good value.

data.title: 24 hours of great food and service!
data.text: First I must point out the hours of operation are in fact 24 hours per day 365 days per year! I'm not sure why the listed hours show closed right now? The Chicken Pot Pie is one of my favorite. Be sure to order early in the day as the number of pies are limited. The Bakery rivals all that I've ever visited in the world. The layer cakes are the best!

data.title: Horrible service, cold food, others ordering after us served before us
data.text: Two times we placed take out orders, and two times the wait was over 45 minutes. We saw others placing orders after us get their food and then when we inquired our order miraculously appeared, but when we got to the room it was COLD. We went back and they made us new fries and hot wings but by then it was 1.5 hours later just to receive what we had paid for. Thinking this was an anomaly we tried again the next night and even told them what had happened previously. It  didn't mater, we saw the same thing unfolding but this time inquired earlier. Our order was brought out but this time it was someone else's food. And yes, it was a gentleman who had ordered 15 minutes after us standing next to us. They finally got the order out 45 minutes after placing the order. All the manager did was say "sorry" and smile at us about 15 times. Dine here at your own risk. By the way we are an interracial couple, the others receiving their food before us were not. This a fact, I don't know if it was a factor.

data.title: Great food and service! Open 24hours too!
data.text: Ate here twice during our stay. Servers are awesome. Food was good and fast. Full bar available as well.

data.title: Double Chocolate Cheescake squished in the middle!!! Do I need to say more??
data.text: Thank you Sue for being so kind and patient.  We couldn't make up our minds.  So we order the double chocolate cake with cheesecake in the middle and a glass of white Zin! DELICIOUS!!

data.title: Hostess as front counter needs extensive training (along with the Manager-type).
data.text: Returned to Millies24 while staying at Eldorado.  Decided to place an order to take back to my room (after a long day).  I approached the hostess, at the front counter, and asked if I may place a to-go order.  She handed me a menu and I told her that I already knew what I wanted to order.  I first ordered a half ham sandwich, on rye, and inquired as to what the soup of the day was.  She had to go to the Manager (I'm assuming he was the Manager) and he told her chicken tortilla soup.  I asked if I could have the chicken noodle (which is a regular menu item) and she said yes.  She asked me several times what type of bread I wanted on the half sandwich and I asked if they have rye.  After the third time, she said wait a minute and she walked to the back of the restaurant where the Manager was.  She returned and told me that they do have rye.  I also ordered a green salad and requested vinaigrette dressing.  (Note:  menu states that all salads come with fresh bread).  After a long wait, she called to me that my order was ready.  I picked it up and asked that everything was in the bag such as silverware, chicken noodle soup and half ham sandwich on rye bread.  She said yes everything is there.  I went against my gut instinct to check the order while I was at the restaurant and instead returned to my room.  That was my first mistake.  While checking the order, I saw that the sandwich was on white bread so returned to the restaurant for the correction.  Same individual just stared at me, took the sandwich and walked away.  Prior to this, I told her that I did not see the fresh bread which is to be supplied with the salad.  She said that she had put it in with the salad herself so she knew it was there.  The Manager was at the other podium and said nothing.  Once I received the sandwich (and checked it) I returned to my room.  Then, I realized that I only received a plastic fork and knife with the order, and how was I to eat the soup.   Once again, returned from the 10th floor to the 3rd to Millies24 to obtain a plastic spoon.  Not one employee to be found anywhere.  After several minutes of waiting, the Manager came from the back, but did not ask me if I needed help.  I told him that I need a spoon in order to eat my soup.  He pointed at the display near the coffee line and told me I could get one there.  When I looked, there were only knives and forks.  I told him that there were no spoons there and he told me to ask one of the individuals at the coffee/ice cream counter for one.  Note:  Had to stand in line in order to request the spoon.  Never once did I receive an apology from either of these employees.  When I returned, yet again, to my room and began eating this very difficult to obtain meal I realized more issues:  There was NO bread with the salad (perhaps she thinks the croutons is the same as bread).  I received TWO salad dressings.  The vinaigrette (which I ordered) which was almost empty (probably running low) and received a large amount of Ranch dressing.  The chicken noodle soup was missing ALL noddles.  NOT one noodle in the entire order.  Albeit a large amount, it was basically filled with largely chopped carrots, celery, odd tasting broth and chicken that looked like it was from the bottom of the barrel. It did appear that there may have been a language issue with these employees, but when working directly with the public the restaurant management should place employees for a suitable position.  As I have dined here, in the past, and have ordered to-go meals, I may very well return to Millies24 the next time I stay at the Eldorado.  However, if this had been someone's first experience with Millies24 I would suspect that it would be the last.  Restaurant management should really address a situation, such as this, and remedy the situation before it loses additional diners.  Very poor service to say the least.

owner_response.author: P_Campitelli, F & B Coordinator at Millies24, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave your comments in regards to your dining experience. We want to apologize that your expectations were not met, as those are not the expectations we set for ourselves. I will be sure to pass your feedback on to our entire team, as we are constantly using this to improve our services for our guests, such as yourself. We hope that you will give us another chance in the future to host you to a true "five star" dining experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dinner at Milles24
data.text: Nice dining room, not too crowded with wide paths to move around. Good food and service, decent prices.

data.title: Great Late Night Menu
data.text:
We at at this restaurant every night/morning. We got in late (midnight) and wanted a snake before calling it a long day and they had a great desert menu and not badly priced. The next night/morning we need to eat something as we just got done bowling and they seemed to be the only one open with a late night menu. We got a good steak and egg's for cheap and we did the same restaurant the next night because of it.
If you are out late and are looking for good food this is the place to go.

data.title: Gelato!!!!
data.text: Stopped here to grab some gelato and, while the selection was limited, it was fantastic.  A generous serving for a ridiculously low price.  I left a very happy customer and will definitely keep this place in mind for the future....

owner_response.author: P_Campitelli, F & B Coordinator at Millies24, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave your comments. I am elated to hear that you enjoyed our freshly homemade gelato and we hope to see you again soon so that you can try another one of our delicious flavors!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best for breakfast, lunch or dinner.
data.text: When staying at the hotel, we always have breakfast here and sometimes lunch.  Food is excellent, service is great, not expensive.  For dinner, had the best breast of chicken with an apricot sauce.
